In the United States about 11.4% of pregnancy-related deaths are from severe bleeding after delivery (postpartum hemorrhage).[^128][^129][^127]

Postpartum hemorrhage (PPH) is a huge amount of blood loss in the first 24 hours of labor and up to 12 weeks after delivery which can cause shock and death.[^130]

Postpartum hemorrhage is the most common preventable cause of maternal death in the US.[^128][^129][^127]

Symptoms of PPH[^128][^129][^131][^132][^133][^134][^127]: 

- Uncontrolled bleeding
- Decreased blood pressure
- Increased heart rate
- Decreased red blood cell count (hematocrit)
- Pain and swelling in vaginal and perianal tissue
- Signs and symptoms of hypovolemic shock

Signs & symptoms of hypovolemic shock[^135]:

- Anxiety
- Agitation
- Confusion
- Rapid breathing
- Low blood pressure
- Weak or rapid heart rate
- Weakness
- Cool, clammy skin
- Pale skin color
- Sweating
- Unconscious
- Unresponsive
- Oxygen saturation less than 95%
- Decreased urine output

Diagnosis of PPH[^131][^132][^133][^134][^136][^137][^138][^139]

- Blood loss of equal to or greater than 500 ml after a vaginal delivery or greater than 1000 ml after a cesarean delivery
- Heart rate and blood pressure measurements
- Hematocrit
- Blood clotting factor levels

Causes of PPH[^128][^129][^131][^132][^133][^134][^136][^137][^138][^139][^127]:

- Uterine atony-the uterus can’t contract
- Retained placenta
- Genital tract trauma
- Placenta abruption-early separation of the placenta from the uterus
- Placenta previa-placenta covers or partially covers the cervix
- Overdistended uterus
- Multiple pregnancies
- Pregnancy-induced hypertension (preeclampsia & eclampsia)
- Prolonged labor
- Infection
- Forceps or vacuum-assisted delivery
- Tears in the cervix, vagina or uterine blood vessel
- Obesity
- Medications to induce labor
- Medications to stop labor
- General anesthesia
- Blood clotting disorders
- Bleeding into pelvis space or tissue
- Placenta accreta: abnormal placenta uterus attachment
- Placenta increta: placenta tissues invade the uterus muscle
- Placenta percreta: placenta tissues are in the uterus muscle

Prevention of PPH: [^128][^129][^131][^132][^133][^134][^136][^137][^138][^139][^127]

- Active management of third stage of labor
- Rapid recognition of excessive bleeding
- Resuscitation and restoration of blood loss
- Find out source of bleeding
- Treatment for bleeding
- Monitoring of vital signs
- Recognition of shock signs & symptoms
